オプション1:
Star Man woke with pain in his throat, nose, and head.
His whole body hurt, and he couldn't get up for a while.
The children sat talking about something.

About an hour and a half later, Star Man got up.
A sharp pain shot through the arm struck by the disk‑shaped monster.
Star Man grabbed his injured left arm with his other hand and moved it slowly.

(My chest feels tight... Maybe because I've only been eating coconuts and acorns...?
I should look for something more like vegetables, too.)
Because it was dangerous outside, Star Man decided to go out alone.

"I'll go pick up acorns.
It's dangerous outside, so please stay here.
Check on Trapezoid Man from time to time."
"Oh, and it'd help if you could clean up."
(Kids are doing the cleaning... I shouldn't expect much...)
Star Man went to Trapezoid Man's room.

"I'm going to pick up more acorns.
I told the kids to stay and clean while I'm gone."
